title: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Santa Fe College)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Santa Fe College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf.  This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement. 

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Re: Florida Sunshine Law Request -
communications.communication:

With regard to Request 3, please see responsive documentation attached.

Thank you,

title: Marjorie Holt

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Marjorie Holt
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Marjorie Sewell Holt (September 17, 1920 – January 6, 2018), who was a U.S. Congresswoman who represented Maryland's 4th congressional district from January 3, 1973 to January 3, 1987.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act. Request: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Connecticut College)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act. Request: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Connecticut College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Colorado Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:
- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be processed by a representative of the news media/press and made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ K Henson }

title: Fauci Vallance Comms

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Fauci Vallance Comms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all written and electronic communications, including email attachments, between Anthony Fauci and Patrick Vallance, the chief scientific adviser for the UK government. 

This request seeks records produced between December 20, 2019 and October 1, 2020. This request does not seek copies of organizational newsletters or other widely available materials of a similar sort.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

title: Bellevue Washington School District #408 - REQUEST FOR COMMUNICATIONS AND WRITINGS of District Leadership Team, current and former Superintendents, and School Board

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue Washington School District #408 - REQUEST FOR COMMUNICATIONS AND WRITINGS of District Leadership Team, current and former Superintendents, and School Board
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern - Bellevue School District #408 :

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [Chapter 42.56 RCW] I hereby request the following records:

REQUEST FOR COMMUNICATIONS AND WRITINGS – PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST FOR ALL 	ELECTRONIC MAIL (E-MAIL), ELECTRONIC TEXTS, TELEPHONE COMMUNICATIONS, TELEPHONE MESSAGES, AND TELEPHONE LOGS of the following individuals for the period of time between January 1, 2019 – November 2, 2021:

Superintendent Dr. Ivan Duran
Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Assistant Superintendent Human Resources, Jeff Thomas 
Executive Director for District and Community Affairs, John Harrison
Director of Research, Evaluation and Assessment Naomi Calvo
Deputy Superintendent Student Academic Performance and Instructional Leadership, Eva Collins
Deputy Superintendent Finance and Operations, Melissa deVita
Chief Communications and Engagement Officer, Janine Thorn
District 1 School Board Member Sima Sarrafa
District 2 School Board Member Carolyn Watson
District 3 School Board Member Erica Melief
District 4 School Board Member Christine Chew
District 5 School Board Member Francine Wiest
Director of Program Office, Melanie McGee
Director Equity and Strategic Engagement, Shomari Jones
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Sharon Kautz
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Heather Edlund
Executive Director of Schools, Patty Siegwarth
Executive Director of Schools, Kelly Aramaki
Executive Director of Schools, Heather Sánchez
Executive Director of Schools, Gloria Henderson

With respect to requests for records that include "communications," I am requesting all emails, text messages, and telephone records, regardless the type of device or account from which the communication was generated or where the device or data is stored (including personal devices such as personal cell phones, laptops, tablets, and/or computers etc. used from home to conduct public business during the COVID-19 Pandemic). Nissen v. Pierce County, 183 Wa.2d 863 (2015).

With respect to requests for records that include "Writings" per 42.56.010(4) this means handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

This request specifically includes - and the District is specifically directed to obtain, preserve in native format, and produce - any records pertaining to public business that exist on any computers, hard drives, portable phones, jump drives, BlackBerries, iPhone, Kindle, IPad, or other devices, or in email, data, voice mail, or text mail accounts owned, controlled or paid for, directly or indirectly, by any agency or 3rd party. 

In the event the District chooses to provide the records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request  a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

For emails I request production of emails in native MICROSOFT .pst (personal storage table) format which allows for a virtually infinite number of emails to be produced in a single digital file, providing for economy and convenience. If the .pst format is not available, I would request production of email in .pdf (portable document format) another widely accepted format for email production providing similar economy and convenience of a virtually infinite number emails bundled  into a single digital .pdf file. 

I request records production by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link if available or USB DRIVE or CD-ROM if not.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

BHS Wolverines

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue Washington School District #408 - REQUEST FOR COMMUNICATIONS AND WRITINGS of District Leadership Team, current and former Superintendents, and School Board
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 2, 2021. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: PRR 11022021-Anon
communications.communication:
PRR 11022021-Anon (NOTE: please refer to this number in all correspondence regarding your request)
Dear Anonymous requestor:
On behalf of the Bellevue School District, I acknowledge receipt of your request as follows:

REQUEST FOR COMMUNICATIONS AND WRITINGS – PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST FOR ALL ELECTRONIC MAIL (E-MAIL), ELECTRONIC TEXTS, TELEPHONE COMMUNICATIONS, TELEPHONE MESSAGES, AND TELEPHONE LOGS of the following individuals for the period of time between January 1, 2019 – November 2, 2021:

Superintendent Dr. Ivan Duran
Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Assistant Superintendent Human Resources, Jeff Thomas
Executive Director for District and Community Affairs, John Harrison
Director of Research, Evaluation and Assessment Naomi Calvo
Deputy Superintendent Student Academic Performance and Instructional Leadership, Eva Collins
Deputy Superintendent Finance and Operations, Melissa deVita
Chief Communications and Engagement Officer, Janine Thorn
District 1 School Board Member Sima Sarrafa
District 2 School Board Member Carolyn Watson
District 3 School Board Member Erica Melief
District 4 School Board Member Christine Chew
District 5 School Board Member Francine Wiest
Director of Program Office, Melanie McGee
Director Equity and Strategic Engagement, Shomari Jones
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Sharon Kautz
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Heather Edlund
Executive Director of Schools, Patty Siegwarth
Executive Director of Schools, Kelly Aramaki
Executive Director of Schools, Heather Sánchez
Executive Director of Schools, Gloria Henderson
Clarification Questions:

  1.  Your request seeks communications “of” the above -named individuals. Please define what you intend by “of.” A reasonable interpretation of that would be that you are seeking records “from” the above individuals. Are you also seeking records “to” the above-named persons? Are you seeking communications on which the above persons were cc’d?
  2.  I assume you intended to refer to School Board Member Sima Sarrafan. Please correct me if I am mistaken.
  3.  It is apparent that your request seeks a very substantial body of records. In the District’s efforts to serve you fully and as efficiently as possible, please consider specifying particular records of interest to you, or at the very least prioritize the records you are seeking in some way that will assist you in determining whether in fact you need all of the records described. For example, you could specify a topic, keywords, or a more narrow date range. You could specify a more targeted group of records to be produced first, while retaining the broader request in case it is needed.

Requestors are required to specify records requested so they are reasonably locatable. While the records you have described are locatable, the volume is extensive. The volume will affect the time required to produce the records.

  1.  I will assume at this time, consistent with the purposes of the Public Records Act, that you are seeking records that are meaningful to you regarding the conduct of the District, and for a legitimate purpose that will not interfere with the efficient administration of the District. Although you are not required under the law to disclose that purpose, I invite you to do so, so that I can assist you in targeting your request to that purpose. If your request is targeted, it will be much easier for you to find records that are meaningful to you within the body of produced records.
  2.  I recognize in this regard that you are requesting more recent records be produced first. Please be advised that it may be possible to honor that request within a body of records of a certain type (such as emails). It may not always be possible to do so consistently across all record types, due to differences in how different types of records are assembled.

In that regard, please specify a date range that you regard as “recent.” For example, are you requesting that the last 6 months of records be produced for all of the persons named above before any earlier records are produced for any other person, at least within a certain type of record? Please be advised that while the District will try to honor your preferences, the District will retain flexibility in this regard in order to process your request most efficiently.



Your answers to the above clarification questions are due on or before December 9, 2021.



Timing of Response

Your request will be completed in a series of installments. At this time, subject to potential adjustment based on your clarifications, I estimate a first installment of records for January 19, 2022. That present estimate is  based on the current workload in this office, staff available to respond to your request, the workload of staff who may be affected by your request and whose assistance may be required, and absences due to illness and/or the anticipated holidays. Response date estimates are subject to change.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11022021
communications.communication:
PRR 11022021-Anon
Dear Anonymous requestor:
Clarification Questions (repeated and follow-ups):

1.                   Regarding clarification question 1:
“Please define what you intend by “of.” A reasonable interpretation of that would be that you are seeking records “from” the above individuals.”
Your answer included this comment:
Regarding the requested public record communications "of" and "from" the previously referenced individuals . . ..
It appears that your answer is that you intend “of” to mean “from.” The District will proceed in that manner unless you advise otherwise.

2.                   Please allow me to explain that In general, email records of each of the named individuals will be searched and produced separately by individual. Some of the search results may be combined in order to avoid a high number of duplications.  The District will retain discretion in this regard in order to process your request most efficiently.
Assuming separate production sets for each individual and some combined groups as appropriate, please advise if you would like to prioritize the individuals listed. The District will try to honor any such priorities, within parameters that are consistent with the most efficient processing of your request.

3.                   You have asked for records to be produced in reverse chronological order, stating that you prefer the District to produce emails first. To clarify, are you asking that all email records back to 1.1.19 for an individual be produced before any records are produced for another individual?

4.                   You did not respond to the questions numbered 3 and 4 (renumbered below due to formatting loss in your reply message) regarding targeting your request. As noted, targeting does not limit your request. Rather, it allows you to prioritize so that the records which will be most meaningful to you in support of your purpose will be produced to you before others. I understand this may be important to you in view of the volume of records you are requesting. For example, in searches performed to date, the number of potentially responsive emails from one individual was 38,743.  Others were in the 28,000 to 36,000 range.



I would be glad to discuss your request with you if it would be helpful. I am often able to help requestors target their requests when I have a better understanding of their priorities.

Please be advised that production of emails in .pst format is not possible. Every record is reviewed for applicable exemptions, and appropriate redactions will be applied prior to the production of records to you. The redaction process occurs only in a .pdf format. Each individual message is converted to a .pdf format.

Your answers to these questions are due on or before December 17, 2021. The timing of your answers may affect the timing of the District’s responses to your request. Additional clarification questions may arise in the course of responding to your request.

I am glad to assist you in accessing records that will be meaningful to you.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

Hello,

Thank you for your email.

With regards to your questions RE: email communications and production priority:

Please produce ALL email communications (any “to” or “from” address fields are irrelevant) of the following individuals for the time period January 1, 2019 – November 2, 2021 in the following order of priority.:

Superintendent Dr. Ivan Duran
Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Assistant Superintendent Human Resources, Jeff Thomas 
Chief Communications and Engagement Officer, Janine Thorn
Director Equity and Strategic Engagement, Shomari Jones
Executive Director for District and Community Affairs, John Harrison
Director of Research, Evaluation and Assessment Naomi Calvo
Deputy Superintendent Student Academic Performance and Instructional Leadership, Eva Collins
Deputy Superintendent Finance and Operations, Melissa deVita
District 1 School Board Member Sima Sarrafan
District 2 School Board Member Carolyn Watson
District 3 School Board Member Erica Melief
District 4 School Board Member Christine Chew
District 5 School Board Member Francine Wiest
Director of Program Office, Melanie McGee
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Sharon Kautz
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Heather Edlund
Executive Director of Schools, Patty Siegwarth
Executive Director of Schools, Kelly Aramaki
Executive Director of Schools, Heather Sánchez
Executive Director of Schools, Gloria Henderson

In the event the District chooses to provide the records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent communications to the earliest by date. 

If possible, it would be helpful to produce the installments of each individual’s emails in staggered 6-month date range blocks. For instance, production of Superintendent Dr. Ivan Duran’s emails dated 5-2-21 through 11-2-21, moving  then to production of Superintendent Dr. Art  Jarvis’s emails dated 5-2-21 through 11-2-21, and cycling through the list based on priority, finally returning to the 2nd block of Superintendent Dr. Ivan Duran’s emails dated 11-2-2020 through 5-2-21 and again cycling though the list of individuals based on priority until the original request is satisfied.  

Thank you.

communications.subject: PRR 10122021-Anon RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11022021
communications.communication:
PRR 10122021-Anon
Dear Anonymous requestor:
Thank you.
Clarification questions:

  1.  When you use the phrase communications “of” an individual, are you referring to:

  1.  communications “from” that individual? Please answer yes or no.

When you use the phrase communications “of” an individual, are you referring to:

  1.  communications “to” that individual? Please answer yes or no.

When you use the phrase communications “of” an individual, are you referring to:

  1.  communications “copied to” that individual? Please answer yes or no.



  1.  You have not responded to the following questions sent to you on 11.9.21, numbered 3 and 4 in that message. This is the District’s third request for a response to these questions:


3.       It is apparent that your request seeks a very substantial body of records. In the District’s efforts to serve you fully and as efficiently as possible, please consider specifying particular records of interest to you, or at the very least prioritize the records you are seeking in some way that will assist you in determining whether in fact you need all of the records described. For example, you could specify a topic, keywords, or a more narrow date range. You could specify a more targeted group of records to be produced first, while retaining the broader request in case it is needed.

Requestors are required to specify records requested so they are reasonably locatable. While the records you have described are locatable, the volume is extensive. The volume will affect the time required to produce the records.

4.       I will assume at this time, consistent with the purposes of the Public Records Act, that you are seeking records that are meaningful to you regarding the conduct of the District, and for a legitimate purpose that will not interfere with the efficient administration of the District. Although you are not required under the law to disclose that purpose, I invite you to do so, so that I can assist you in targeting your request to that purpose. If your request is targeted, it will be much easier for you to find records that are meaningful to you within the body of produced records.


In reminding you om 11.17.21 to respond to questions 3 and 4, I explained the importance to you of your answering these questions:

As noted, targeting does not limit your request. Rather, it allows you to prioritize so that the records which will be most meaningful to you in support of your purpose will be produced to you before others. I understand this may be important to you in view of the volume of records you are requesting. For example, in searches performed to date, the number of potentially responsive emails from one individual was 38,743. Others were in the 28,000 to 36,000 range.

I would be glad to discuss your request with you if it would be helpful. I am often able to help requestors target their requests when I have a better understanding of their priorities.
Thank you for clarifying your request at the outset. It is essential that we have a mutual understanding. Additional clarifications may arise in the course of processing your request. Your answers to the questions above are due on or before December 17, 2021. The timing of your answers will affect the timing of the District’s response.

Missing correspondence history
Please review the message you sent on 11.19.21 at 1:39 PM, and the message you sent on 11.18.21. In each of those messages, portions of the correspondence history between you and this office were missing, including but not limited to the 11.9.21 message to you containing the clarification questions above, to which you have not yet responded.
Perhaps this is a technical aberration of the service you are using. If necessary, please work with Muckrock to determine why portions of correspondence history related to your request may not be retained when you reply to a message. For example, your 11.19.21 message immediately below contains a history that skips from your message dated 11.02.21 to your message dated 11.11.21. Please take steps to prevent that from occurring in the future.


Public Records Request Process

You state:

“No search need be conducted – archive or copy the entire email account for the dates requested and produce the result preferably in .PST format.”



Please allow me to help you understand public record response procedures, so that your expectations can be realistic. When a request for records is made, the District conducts a search for potentially responsive records. When potentially responsive records are assembled, each record is reviewed to determine whether it is responsive, and if so, whether the law requires that exemptions be applied to it. If some or all of a record is exempt, the District applies redactions to that record or withholds it, and then describes to the requestor the basis for any exemptions that were applied. As noted below, it is not possible to produce records in .PST format, because records must first be converted to .PDF format in order to apply redactions to them.

For these reasons, it is not possible to “copy” the contents of “an entire email account” and produce all emails within such a an account to you. Each email must first be reviewed, analyzed, and processed for production.

As noted in my 11.09.021 message to you, your request will be completed in a series of installments. Due to the procedures described above, only a limited number of email records can be produced per installment. Each request is unique, but given the workload of this office, email records can be generally processed at a rate of perhaps 30-100 individual emails per installment. Installments may occur at varying intervals, which can be 30 days or more. These processing volume rates vary widely based on the nature of the request and other factors.
As stated above, during the nearly 3-year period you have identified, one of the persons on your list sent 38,743 emails—that is 38,743 emails were “from” that person. There may be some duplications within that number. However, even if that number was significantly reduced to something in the range of 20,000 emails, and assuming a rate of processing those records at 100 per month, it could take 200 months, or more than 16 years, to process only the emails “from” that one person on your list.

I am taking the time to explain this to you in detail, at the beginning of processing your request, so that you can understand how important it is to you, assuming your intention is to receive records that are meaningful to you and relate to a legitimate purpose, to limit your request by targeting it in some way as described in questions 3 and 4 above. I can help you find the needle in the haystack that you really want. You do not need to ask for the haystack to achieve your legitimate purpose.

I am available to assist you in exploring options by which you can limit your request so that it will yield records that will be meaningful to you, while retaining your broader request in case it is needed.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

Thank you for responding. From the questions in my 11.09.21 message:
Question 3 could be answered by stating: “I decline to specify my request,” or by specifying your request so that the District can better assist you by processing it more efficiently.

communications.subject: RE: PRR 11022021-Anon RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11022021
communications.communication:
PRR 11022021-Anon
Dear Requestor:
Thank you for responding. An additional clarification question has arisen and the District awaits your answer to two other questions. The District appreciates your answers to all clarification questions to be certain we have a mutual understanding.
Clarification question, 11.24.21:
Your request identifies persons by name and title. Some of the named persons did not hold the stated title during the entire date range of the request. The District understands your request to be for communication records to, from, or cc any of the named persons during those portions of the stated date range in which the named person held the stated title. Please confirm or otherwise clarify.
Your answer to this clarification question is due on or before December 24, 2021. The business day will end at noon Pacific Time on that date.

Pending clarification questions, 11.09.21:
The District awaits your answers to questions 3 and 4 from my 11.09.21 message, as described in my message to you immediately below dated 11.22.2021. Those answers are due December 17, 2021.

Timing of Response:
The timing of your answers may affect the timing of the District’s responses to your request. Additional clarification questions may arise in the course of responding to your request.

As set forth in my 11.09.21 message to you, at this time, subject to potential adjustment based on your clarifications, I estimate a first installment of records for January 19, 2022. That present estimate is based on the current workload in this office, staff available to respond to your request, the workload of staff who may be affected by your request and whose assistance may be required, and absences due to illness and/or the anticipated holidays. Response date estimates are subject to change.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11022021
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Boyer,

ANSWERS TO YOUR CLARIFICATION QUESTIONS:

QUESTION

“Your request identifies persons by name and title. Some of the named persons did not hold the stated title during the entire date range of the request. The District understands your request to be for communication records to, from, or cc any of the named persons during those portions of the stated date range in which the named person held the stated title. Please confirm or otherwise clarify.”

ANSWER

Please provide all communications records to, from, or cc any of the named persons for the date range between January 1, 2019 – November 2, 2021 regardless of title.

QUESTION

“Question 3 could be answered by stating: “I decline to specify my request,” or by specifying your request so that the District can better assist you by processing it more efficiently.”

ANSWER

I understand I “could” modify this public records request. Thank you I understand that I could do that. 
 
QUESTION

“Question 4 could be answered by stating: “I decline to identify the purpose of my request,” or by identifying a legitimate purpose of your request so that the District better assist you in targeting it so that it can be processed more efficiently.”

ANSWER

I understand I “could” provide you with my purpose for making this public records request. Thank you I understand that I could do that. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11022021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 2, 2021. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Jan. 19, 2022. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #11022021.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11022021, Installment 1
communications.communication:
PRR 11022021-Anon
Dear Requestor:
On behalf of the Bellevue School District, I am making a first installment in response to your request for records. You requested emails to be produced in reverse chron order, in 6 month blocks, to/from/cc the following persons in this following order:

Superintendent Dr. Ivan Duran
Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Assistant Superintendent Human Resources, Jeff Thomas
Chief Communications and Engagement Officer, Janine Thorn
Director Equity and Strategic Engagement, Shomari Jones
Executive Director for District and Community Affairs, John Harrison
Director of Research, Evaluation and Assessment Naomi Calvo
Deputy Superintendent Student Academic Performance and Instructional Leadership, Eva Collins
Deputy Superintendent Finance and Operations, Melissa deVita
District 1 School Board Member Sima Sarrafan
District 2 School Board Member Carolyn Watson
District 3 School Board Member Erica Melief
District 4 School Board Member Christine Chew
District 5 School Board Member Francine Wiest
Director of Program Office, Melanie McGee
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Sharon Kautz
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Heather Edlund
Executive Director of Schools, Patty Siegwarth
Executive Director of Schools, Kelly Aramaki
Executive Director of Schools, Heather Sánchez
Executive Director of Schools, Gloria Henderson
To give you a sense of the volume of records you have requested, searches of potentially responsive records for the following persons for the first six-month period, 05 01 21 through 11 02 21, returned the following numbers of potentially responsive messages to be reviewed and processed for production to you:

Superintendent Dr. Ivan Duran                                                                   8420
Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis                                                                      7245
Assistant Superintendent Human Resources, Jeff Thomas              25,244
Chief Communications and Engagement Officer, Janine Thorn     13.443
Total for these 4 individuals, 05 01 21-11 02 21:                                  53,952

This installment includes emails to/from/cc Superintendent Ivan Duran for the period 10 01 21-10 14 21. This is roughly the first half of the month of October 2021, consisting of 446 messages. The period 10 15 21-11 02 21 will be the subject of the next installment.

The records are being produced to you via Box, from which you may retrieve, view, and download records. Please click the link below to retrieve the following records:
NOTE: I am having technical difficulties creating this link. I will complete this process as soon as possible.

Please note that Dr. Duran has not been employed by the District since the spring of 2021. As a result, there are no messages from him in this group. The vast majority of messages are commercial solicitations, newsletters or subscriptions; messages on which Dr. Duran was copied because his name may not have yet been deleted from a distribution group; or messages from persons who did not know of his status.

My observation in processing your request to date is that it could be completed more efficiently if you limited the volume of potentially responsive records to retrieve messages that are more likely to be of interest to you. This could be accomplished in a number of ways. For example, you could consider redefining “communications of” to mean “to” or “from” but not “cc”; limiting the date range; limiting the request to one or more topics of interest; identifying key words; and/or agreeing that commercial solicitations, newsletters, and subscriptions would not be responsive.
No redactions were made to these records.

I estimate the next installment for February 25, 2022.
In order to expedite the District’s response to your request, please consider limiting the request to a reasonable volume that is more likely to be of interest to you, as suggested above.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request #11022021, Installment 2
communications.communication:
PRR 11022021-Anon
Dear Requestor:
On behalf of the Bellevue School District, I am making a second installment in response to your request for records. You requested emails to be produced in reverse chron order, in 6 month blocks, to/from/cc the following persons in this following order:

Superintendent Dr. Ivan Duran
Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Assistant Superintendent Human Resources, Jeff Thomas
Chief Communications and Engagement Officer, Janine Thorn
Director Equity and Strategic Engagement, Shomari Jones
Executive Director for District and Community Affairs, John Harrison
Director of Research, Evaluation and Assessment Naomi Calvo
Deputy Superintendent Student Academic Performance and Instructional Leadership, Eva Collins
Deputy Superintendent Finance and Operations, Melissa deVita
District 1 School Board Member Sima Sarrafan
District 2 School Board Member Carolyn Watson
District 3 School Board Member Erica Melief
District 4 School Board Member Christine Chew
District 5 School Board Member Francine Wiest
Director of Program Office, Melanie McGee
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Sharon Kautz
Executive Director Teaching and Learning, Heather Edlund
Executive Director of Schools, Patty Siegwarth
Executive Director of Schools, Kelly Aramaki
Executive Director of Schools, Heather Sánchez
Executive Director of Schools, Gloria Henderson
This installment includes emails to/from/cc Superintendent Ivan Duran for the period 10 15 21 through 10 21 2021. It includes 227 messages. The period 10 22 2021 through 11 02 2021 will be the subject of the next installment.

The records are being produced to you via Box, from which you may retrieve, view, and download records, within 30 days of receipt. A link will be provided to you to access the records in a message that will follow shortly.

Please note that Dr. Duran has not been employed by the District since the spring of 2021. As a result, there are no messages from him in this group. The vast majority of messages are commercial solicitations, newsletters or subscriptions; messages on which Dr. Duran was copied because his name may not have yet been deleted from a distribution group; or messages from persons who did not know of his status.

Your request could be completed more efficiently if you limited the volume of potentially responsive records to retrieve messages that are more likely to be of interest to you. This could be accomplished in a number of ways. For example, you could consider redefining “communications of” to mean “to” or “from” but not “cc”; limiting the number of persons whose communications are sought; limiting the date range; limiting the request to one or more topics of interest; identifying key words; and/or agreeing that commercial solicitations, newsletters, and subscriptions would not be responsive.

Redactions were made to one record in this set, consistent with exemptions set forth in the Public Records Act. Redactions are indicated by blocked out text with an overlying code. I have also attached to this message a Redaction and Exemption Codes chart that explains the basis for the exemptions that applied.  If there are any records that contain marked out texts that do not have an overlying code, that is the form in which the record was received by the District.

I estimate the next installment for March 30, 2022.
In order to expedite the District’s response to your request, please consider limiting the request to a reasonable volume that is more likely to be of interest to you, as suggested above.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

Why is your agency withholding these requested public records? 

Who at your agency is responsible for compliance with the Washington State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56)?

When will your agency produce the public records requested?

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #11022021
communications.communication:
PRR 11022021-Anon-Muckrock
Dear Requestor:
The Bellevue School District is not withholding any records from you.
Please direct all messages pertaining to your request to the public records mailbox, publicrecords@bsd405.org.
The automated correspondence features of the Muckrock site are not an efficient way to correspond or to review correspondence. Please do not interrupt our correspondence history by cutting messages out of the email string. I know that history can get long. However, it is important in order for us to communicate effectively that an accurate history of our communications is readily available to both of us.
Please allow me to summarize our recent correspondence:

Feb 25–email from BSD, making second installment consisting of 227 emails, and providing link to Box for records.
Feb 26—confirmation from Box site to BSD that you accepted and opened link to records.
June 29—email from you, stating you had received only one installment, on 1.9.22.
June 29–email from BSD, setting a next installment for July 21.
July 15—email from you, inquiring as to status. Appears to be automated Muckrock email. June 29 message from BSD does not appear to have been read.
July 21—email from BSD, inquiring further about your statement on June 29 that you had received only one installment, and listing two installments that were produced. Attached your 2.26.22 acceptance of link to second installment provided via Box site. Advised that estimated installment intended for July 21 would be extended to July 22.
July 25, 26, 28 – emails from BSD, extending estimated dates from July 22 to August 1, with explanations.
Aug 3–email from you, explaining (for the first time) that you were not able to open the link to records that were sent to you on 2.25.22.

Installment 2 Produced to You Again
First, let’s take care of your receipt of the records in the February 25 installment. You were advised in a February 25 email that a link to the records was on its way to you. I received confirmation on February 26 that you accepted and opened the link that was sent to you. Now, on August 3, you explain for the first time that you were not able to retrieve records in the link that was provided to you. If you had let me know in February that you had difficulty retrieving the records, we could have resolved it at that time. I recognize there may be glitches with technology. I am glad to work with you to resolve them promptly, if you let me know.

Each installment is made available to you for 30 days. In the future, if you do not acknowledge and accept receipt of records within 30 days after they are made available to you, your request will be closed as abandoned.

I am re-sending you the records that were provided to you in installment 2 on February 25, 2021. I will attach these to two emails to you, due to their volume.

Installment 2 consisted of 227 email records covering a period of October 15-21, 2021, in zip folders are follows:
2021 10 15_10 19, Duran, 122 (attached here)
2021 10 20_10 21, Duran, 105 (will be attached to an email that follows)

The second zip folder includes a record that contains information that is exempt from disclosure under the Public Records Act. Exempt information is redacted and marked with an overlay code. I will attach to the following email a Redaction and Exemption Codes chart that explains the basis of exemptions applied.

Progress on your high-volume request
Please appreciate the overall high volume of your request, when there are 227 email records in one week for one of your named recipients. Each individual email record you request must be retrieved from archives, reviewed for applicability to your request and for exemptions, and then prepared for production to you.
Due to typical operational capacity of this department, it is generally possible to process roughly 100 email records per installment, and to make installments to a requestor every 60 to 90 days. These are general capacity numbers, which may be adjusted in different contexts for different types of requests. Most requestors seek specific information that is likely to be meaningful to them, which allows for effective and efficient request processing.
Your request, on the other hand, seeks a high volume of communications, from a large group of persons, with no specific focus or topic. As a result, the volume of records will be is very high, the retrieval time is extensive, and the review process is very time-consuming.
You have been provided 446 records in installment 1, Jan 19 2022; and 227 records in installment 2, February 25 2022, for a total of 673 records. This is well within standard processing rate.

Next Estimated Installment
The District attempts to meet its estimated installment dates. Sometimes that is not possible. If it is not possible to meet an estimated date, you will be provided an explanation and a revised estimated date.
The time it took to complete today’s correspondence was time the District was not able to devote to a next installment to you.
I estimate a next installment for September 1, 2022. That estimate takes into account factors of summer staff absences; staff absences for other reasons, including medical leaves; the current workload of this department; and the complexity of assembly and review required for your request as set forth above.
Best regards,

Helen A. Boyer
Public Records Officer
Bellevue School District No. 405
425-456-4101
publicrecords@bsd405.org<mailto:publicrecords@bsd405.org>

communications.subject: Introducing all-new Box Notes
communications.communication:
Service Notification



 
<https://www.box.com/home?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=Email&utm_theme=CloudContentManagement&id=&utm_content=notes2-eng&utm_buid=18391578177>

 



Dear valued customer,



Box Notes is where people work together, securely and collaboratively, to 
achieve better results. And, we are excited to let you know that you will begin 
upgrading to the all-new Box Notes starting August 17, 2022.



All-new Box Notes supports a broader range of content collaboration activities 
and includes powerful enhancements for real-time collaboration and organization 
including

 * new content creation capabilities like advanced table functions, call-out 
boxes, and quote blocks
 * additional display and formatting options such as enhanced typography, 
image, and code blocks
 * more ways to  organize your content with automated table of contents and 
divider lines
 * and in-line cursors that help you keep track of collaborator edits for more 
productive and streamlined collaboration.


What you need to know about the upgrade

All-new Box Notes will be rolled out automatically to you. Once upgraded to 
the new experience, any Notes you create will be able to leverage all the 
fantastic features we’ve built. Existing notes will be automatically converted 
to the new experience with On-Demand Migration—meaning when an old Note is 
accessed, it will be converted to the new format—a process that takes 
milliseconds. After we complete the rollout of all-new Box Notes to all 
customers, we will migrate all remaining notes not covered by on-demand 
migration. 



Learn more about the all-new Box Notes with the following resources:

 * The product announcement 
<https://support.box.com/hc/en-us/articles/6990288241171-Introducing-all-new-Box-Notes?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=Email&utm_theme=CloudContentManagement&id=&utm_content=notes2-eng&utm_buid=18391578177>
, which introduces all-new Box Notes
 * All-new Box Notes support article 
<https://support.box.com/hc/en-us/articles/360044195933-Introducing-Box-Notes?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=Email&utm_theme=CloudContentManagement&id=&utm_content=notes2-eng&utm_buid=18391578177>
, which provides an overview of this new functionality
 * List of known issues 
<https://support.box.com/hc/en-us/articles/8427168240147?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=Email&utm_theme=CloudContentManagement&id=&utm_content=notes2-eng&utm_buid=18391578177>
 that the team has uncovered during the upgrade process


This move will not cause any disruption to your Box instance or your users, 
but if you have any questions, please open a ticket with Box Product Support at
support.box.com 
<http://support.box.com/?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=Email&utm_theme=CloudContentManagement&id=&utm_content=notes2-eng&utm_buid=18391578177>
.


Sincerely,
The Box team


You are receiving this operational email as the owner of your free Box 
account. If you have any questions, please reach out toBox Product Support. 
<https://support.box.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?utm_source=iterable&utm_medium=Email&utm_theme=CloudContentManagement&id=&utm_content=notes2-eng&utm_buid=18391578177>

title: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (California State University, Long Beach)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: California Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (California State University, Long Beach)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kayla Henson

communications.subject: PRA 22-082: Pepsi Coca-Cola Contract
communications.communication:
RE:  PRA REQUEST 22-082



Dear Kayla Henson:


We received your California Public Records Act Request on January 23, 2023, for the following records:


  1.  A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
  2.  If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
  3.  If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

Under Government Code section 6253, we will conduct a reasonable search for the records identified, and we will make available for your inspection all public records (see, Sections 6254 and 6255) that are responsive.

We will contact you when these records are available.  We will redact from them personal and otherwise privileged information.  If you wish us to provide you with paper or scanned electronic copies of these records, the CSU charge is .20 cents per page.  Once the records are gathered, we can advise you as to the exact number of pages encompassed by your request.  Copies will be made available to you upon receipt of payment.  If you wish instead to inspect the original records once they have been identified, a mutually convenient date will be arranged.


Please continue to direct all records requests and questions directly to our office by email at publicrecords@csulb.edu<mailto:publicrecords@csulb.edu> or FAX at (562) 985-2411.

Sincerely,

Dominique Dupuy
Administration and Public Records Analyst
California State University, Long Beach
1250 Bellflower Blvd, BH 320
Long Beach, CA 90840
(562) 985-7794

Please be aware, under California Public Record Act (Government Code § 6250-6270), all email sent by or to me on this state-owned e-mail account may be subject to public disclosure.

If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.

title: SEC, Aug '22

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: SEC, Aug '22
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any warning letters sent by the SEC during the month of August 2022.

2. Any civil investigatory demand letters sent by the SEC during the month of August 2022.

3. Any letters sent to the SEC commissioner by a member of Congress or White House official during the month of August 2022.

4. Any letters sent by the SEC commissioner to a member of Congress or White House official during the month of August 2022.

5. Any FOIA requests to the SEC responded during the month of August 2022, and the responsive documents.

6. Any SEC OIG reports delivered during the month of August 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lewis Manning

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #22-02911-FOIA
communications.communication:
I'm interested in understanding the total volume and scope of official letters sent by the SEC that in some way warn an outside entity of their potential non-compliance with SEC rules. I'm not very familiar with the SEC, so I'm not sure how best to narrow the request.

Alternatively, would it be less work to provide all official letters (eg. written on official letterhead) sent during August 2022? That might be more interesting to me and require less filtering by you.

To reduce your workload, I'm happy to narrow the request however you recommend.

communications.subject: FOIA Request No. 22-02910-FOIA - response requested
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Mr. Manning,

We are processing your request for "[a]ny FOIA requests to the SEC responded during the month of August 2022, and the responsive documents." This request was assigned tracking number 22-02910-FOIA.

We need to request clarification of your request in order to identify the information of most interest to you. Are you interested in the response letters for just those requests where records were provided?

We respond to a high volume of FOIA requests where there is no information found and no records are provided to the requester. We receive between 10,000-13,000 requests per year, so our volume of outgoing final response letters for a single month may be 1,000 letters or more, including only interim and final response letters (not including acknowledgement letters, other types of administrative letters, emails, etc.). Further, these letters are only stored in each individual request file and would require an extensive manual search.

Depending on the information you are seeking, it might be possible to arrange for an alternative to the letters, such as a list of all requests that were closed during the time period of your request where records were provided.

Please let us know at your earliest convenience how you would like you proceed. We will place your request on hold until we hear back, and we would request that you please respond by Wednesday, November 2. We will be happy to work with you to determine the best way to provide the information you are seeking.

Thank you,
Carrie Hyde-Michaels
FOIA Branch Chief
U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission
Office of FOIA Services
hyde-michaelsc@sec.gov<mailto:hyde-michaelsc@sec.gov>
Direct: (202) 551-5816

files.title: Lewis Manning22-02910-FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #23-00001-OIG
communications.communication:
Hello Carrie,

Thank you for the explanation, and I'm happy to narrow my request to reduce your workload. I would prefer to have a list of all closed requests and any responsive documents. If that would require an extensive manual search, I would like a list of all requests that were closed with responsive documents. If that would also require an extensive manual search, I would like a list of all requests along with their final disposition.

Please feel free to choose whichever of these options is most reasonable.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOD/Army 1.3.23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

All contacting records responsive to Shield Analysis Technology LLC and Denise N. Baken (award IDs: W81XWH18C0086, W81XWH22P0109, and and W9133L19C2501). Shield Analysis Technology LLC was awarded contracts between Fiscal Years 2018 and 2022 with the Department of Defense (DOD) through its subsidiary agency, the Department of the Army. This request includes, but is not limited to:

- Current and previous contracts

- Requests for Proposals

- Initial Bid Documents

- Memorandum(s) of Understanding

- Letters of Interest

- Privacy impact assessments

- Invoices

- Change Orders

- Presentations by Shield Analysis Technology LLC or Denise N. Baken

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media, with bylines including Covert Action Magazine, Janata Weekly, and Philly Voice. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

communications.subject: FOIA Received and Redirected FP-23-006393/FA-23-0043
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Skvarla,

 

Your FOIA request related for contracts: W81XWH18C0086,W81XWH22P0109, and
W9133L19C2501, was received in the Headquarters - Army Contracting Command
(HQ-ACC) FOIA Office on 3 January 2023.

 

The HQ-ACC FOIA Office is not the record custodian for the information you
requested.  Therefore, your request will be referred to the Organizations
that have purview for the requested information.

 

Contact information for the Medical Command (MEDCOM) and the Army National
Guard Bureau (NGB) FOIA Offices is listed below:

 

MEDCOM (W81XWH18C0086,W81XWH22P0109)

CDR, USAMRDC
ATTN: FCMR-SG
810 Schreider Street
Fort Detrick, MD 21702-5000

 <mailto:USArmy.Detrick.MEDCOM-USAMRMC.mbx.FOIA@health.mil>
USArmy.Detrick.MEDCOM-USAMRMC.mbx.FOIA@health.mil

 

Army National Guard (W9133L19C2501)

NGB FOIA Office (NGB/JA-OIP)

111 South George Mason Drive, AH2

Arlington, VA 22204-1373

ngb.foia@army.mil <mailto:ngb.foia@army.mil> 

 

 

Upon receipt of your request, the MEDCOM and NGB FOIA Offices will advise
you on how they will process this request.  Additionally, they may refer
your request to the appropriate subcomponent to review, make a release
determination, assess fees and provide you with a response. 

 

Please do not hesitate to contact the HQ-ACC FOIA Office if you have any
questions about your FOIA Request.  Also, ensure you include your FOIA case
number when corresponding with the HQ-ACC FOIA Team.

 

 

 

Very Respectfully,

Ms. Sonya D. Moman

Headquarters, Army Contracting Command

FOIA Officer

title: Dixon Correctional Center - Budget

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Dixon Correctional Center - Budget
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to Dixon Correctional Center:


Dixon Correctional Center's yearly budgeting plans for 2022 and 2023, along with any fiscal reports related to mental health or medical care costs from 2021, 2022, and 2023.


In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ivan Glynn

title: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All materials and records describing and sufficient to show/disclose all allegations of misconduct made and all disciplinary proceedings taken against any officer, employee, or representative of this policing agency. 

As described in the New York Freedom of Information Law, a record is "any information kept, held, filed, produced or reproduced by, with or for an agency or the state legislature, in any physical form whatsoever including, but not limited to, reports, statements, examinations, memoranda, opinions, folders, files, books, manuals, pamphlets, forms, papers, designs, drawings, maps, photos, letters, microfilms, computer tapes or discs, rules, regulations or codes." Records kept in a digital or electronic form are also records, would be responsive to this request, and should be provided. 

These records are typically required to be retained under the New York State Records Retention and Disposition Schedule MU-1 (http://www.archives.nysed.gov/records/retention_mu-1), including, but not limited to, item no. 365, which includes: "Investigative records and disciplinary proceedings, including but not limited to statement of charge, transcript of hearing, notice of decision, letter of termination or resignation, letter of reinstatement, record of appeal procedure, and correspondence." While materials under that schedule have a set retention of 3 years after the final decision rendered, this request and materials responsive to it include *all* records held in the possession of any office or individual employed or formerly employed by this policing agency, including those kept off-site, in digital form, and in personnel files. 

Please note that any failure to provide all potentially-responsive materials and/or the destruction of materials potentially responsive to this request would be a violation of the spirit of the New York Freedom of Information Law, as well as unlawful under the New York FOIL and the terms of the attached litigation hold notice.

Materials responsive to this request include — but are not limited to — all complaints, reports, records of discipline and penalties, aggregate collections of complaint and disciplinary materials (spreadsheets, databases), investigatory materials, relevant related correspondence, photographs, video, other related evidence, proof of discipline or fulfillment of penalties, and all personnel materials (including those used in promotion, contract, and other employment negotiations and considerations) that reference or utilize misconduct allegations or disciplinary materials of any sort.

Materials responsive to this request include all complaints— internal, external, and civilian — and include records disclosing the names, badge numbers, and personnel identification of each officer involved and/or serving as a witness, as well as all available details of the incident/complaint: date, time, location, nature of the incident, description of the incident, nature of the investigation, investigatory materials, the disposition of the case, and any subsequent materials related to the execution of any resultant discipline. Responsive materials include all complaints and allegations against any officer, employee, or representative of this policing agency, regardless of whether that complaint or allegation resulted in any investigation or disciplinary action. 

Responsive materials also include all records of use of force by officers, including records disclosing the names, badge numbers, and personnel identification of each officer involved and/or serving as a witness, as well as all available details of the incident: date, time, location, nature of the incident, description of the incident, nature of the use of force, subsequent investigatory materials related to the use of force, the disposition of any investigation into the incident, and any subsequent materials related to the use of force. 

Please provide materials on a rolling basis, beginning with materials created during the following timeframes: 
• January 1, 2010 - June 15, 2020
• January 1, 2000 - January 1, 2010
• January 1, 1990 - January 1, 2000
• January 1, 1980 - January 1, 1990
• January 1, 1970 - January 1, 1980

Pursuant to NYCRR Section 1401.5(c)(1), should any of this request be unclear or lack sufficient description for your office, please provide direction that would enable this requester to request records reasonably described. Please also note that the New York FOIL states: "An agency shall not deny a request on the basis that the request is voluminous or that locating or reviewing the requested records or providing the requested copies is burdensome because the agency lacks sufficient staffing or on any other basis if the agency may engage an outside professional service to provide copying, programming or other services required to provide the copy...." Please also see FOIL AO 19671, an Advisory Opinion from the Committee on Open Government [https://docs.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f19671.htm]. 

If your office has questions about this request or would like to discuss it for any reason, please contact this requester via the contact email address provided and feel free to follow up by phone: 617-299-1832. This request is being submitted to each policing agency in New York as part of a collaborative project led by MuckRock and involving multiple other educational and journalistic partners and participants. For this reason, over the lifetime of this request, your agency may interface with individuals not listed on this initial communication. 

This request is being made in the public interest by a news organization as part of non-profit (not commercial) journalistic work and research on behalf of the public. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request and as part of the necessary negotiations for successful processing. As far as it is possible, please fulfill elements of this request electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: Link expired
communications.communication:
In reference to the FOIL request for police disciplinary files/use of force files, I have tried to use the link that was sent to us in the past to download documents, but it states that it has expired.  Subsequent links that have been sent to the main WPD email account seemed to immediately expire.  Can you please send me a link directly to my email below?

Thank you,
C. Donoghue

Charles P. Donoghue
Chief of Police
Watertown Police Department
751 Waterman Drive
Watertown, NY 13601
(315) 786-2610
cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov<mailto:cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov>

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
Hello, Chief Donoghue —

Thanks so much for your message. Could you please let me know if you have trouble with the link attached to this message?

I really appreciate your help. 

Best wishes,
Beryl

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
Beryl,

The link sent me to a page that stated, “Your login token has expired. You may send a new one now to CDonoghue@watertown-ny.gov<mailto:CDonoghue@watertown-ny.gov>.”  I pressed the button that is labeled “Resend token,” and it sent me another email with the same link.  That link also sent me to the same page with a resend link button and the same message.  I can send documents via regular email if that is easier than trying to figure out the link issue.  If so, let me know what email to send the documents to.

Thanks,
C. Donoghue

Charles P. Donoghue
Chief of Police
Watertown Police Department
751 Waterman Drive
Watertown, NY 13601
(315) 786-2610
cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov<mailto:cdonoghue@watertown-ny.gov>

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Police department misconduct allegations and disciplinary proceedings
communications.communication:
Hello, Chief Donoghue —

I apologize for having missed your earlier message. I wonder if the upload link is now working? If not, regular email or via Google Drive would be fine.

Thanks so much for your patience and help. I really appreciate it.

Best wishes,
Beryl

Thanks,

Charles P. Donoghue
Chief of Police
Watertown Police Department
751 Waterman Drive
Watertown, NY 13601

title: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Northern Michigan University)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Northern Michigan University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Michigan Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Michigan Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Northern Michigan University)
